page.title: 11FARMING IN WICHENFORD
page.content: The{parish of Wichenford}is a very lush farming area, with{grazing, crops and{orchards}all thriving. On{Laughern Hill}one mixed farm of 400 acres has 130 head of{beef,}250{ewes, {sugar beet, corn}and{potatoes. Further south{goats}and{horses}are seen grazing in paddocks. To the north are Bulmers apple{orchards,}and on the eastern boundary{vegetable gardens}and {nursery stock}adjoin{berry}fields. The{Wichenford Court estates}stretch along the parish, with 500{ewes, {wheat, barley, oats, rape, field beans and{jam fruits. {Farm equipment}is modern and efficient with fan{silos}and{combine harvester. Here too, are{Arab ponies}bred for showing, and driving traps. From the smallest field to the largest estate, all Wichenford farms are{busy and{productive.
